name: py-datalad-hirni

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: DataLad extension for raw data capturing and conversion workflows

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-datalad
dependencies.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependencies.name: py-datalad-metalad
dependencies.description: DataLad extension for semantic metadata handling

dependencies.name: py-datalad-neuroimaging
dependencies.description: DataLad extension package for neuro/medical imaging

dependencies.name: py-datalad-container
dependencies.description: DataLad extension package for working with containerized environments

dependencies.name: py-datalad-webapp
dependencies.description: DataLad extension for exposing commands via a web request API

dependencies.name: git-annex
dependencies.description:
git-annex allows managing files with git, without checking the file
contents into git. While that may seem paradoxical, it is useful when
dealing with files larger than git can currently easily handle, whether
due to limitations in memory, time, or disk space.
